metadata.title: CVE-2015-3905 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in the set_cs_start function in t1disasm.c in t1utilsbefore 1.39 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash)and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted font file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

t1utils - 1.37-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: t1utils package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.37-2ubuntu1.1').
